cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn northwest, cross central-western Cuba Monday, then move northward through the eastern Gulf toward Florida’s west coast and the Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west-central coast (near the Tampa–Cedar Key corridor)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas (no watches posted for southeast Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None along Florida coastline at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast from the Keys northward to the Big Bend, interior peninsula, and coastal Georgia/South Carolina later in the period
weather_observation.wind: 10–20% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (peak onset probability ~8%) with gusts potentially 35–45 mph early Tuesday through early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida Atlantic coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible early next week which may cause brief localized ponding and minor urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated seas off the Palm Beach coast as Elsa passes to the west
